posts.name: Chris
posts.cooked: Alright, We are currently attempting to run mk4I swerve modules with Kraken Drive, Neo Steer,  and a CANcoder (which will become important here in a second). We are trying to use YAGSL for the first time this year and we have swerve working to an extent. We were able to get the main drive portion working which includes - Forwards, Backwords - Left, and Right. However when we try and use the right joystick to turn it does move… slightly, and then it starts to ping pong back and forth, we know this is not a PID issue because after spending a decent amount of time trying to tune PID ’s it never ended. Our second issue is with our encoder readings. When we re-initialize the robot (re-deploy of code or power reset) it does not zero back out when we try and run the swerve, it keeps the same position it had when starting up (so if the wheels were all turned in a weird way it would stay that way and not zero out). Any and all help is greatly appreciated! I will also attach our code here: Swerve Code

posts.name: Konnor/RetroBuzz | 5517AM
posts.cooked: Can you send a video of the robot and elastic swerve widget?

posts.name: Chris
posts.cooked: I dont have a video of it currently

posts.name: Konnor/RetroBuzz | 5517AM
posts.cooked:
Also try setting your heading pid back to default of .118.

Also are your devices actually on a different canbus image 419×570 8.09 KB

image 419×570 8.09 KB

posts.name: Chris
posts.cooked: I was under the understanding that the kraken x60 motors had to be completely different than the neo motors
The default canbus for the rio is ”rio” not ”Rio”

posts.name: Chris
posts.cooked: would that be the result in our ping ponging issue tho?

posts.name: Konnor/RetroBuzz | 5517AM
posts.cooked: Your use spark pid values for your talon drive. Use 1 for your pid.

posts.name: Konnor/RetroBuzz | 5517AM
posts.cooked: Also are you able to get a video?
part of it, are you using a canivore too?

posts.name: Ömer YILMAZ
posts.cooked: I do not recommend Neo for rotation, if the drive is Kraken, when the drive is suddenly lifted, the Neo engine cannot stand the torque, the chassis wobbles during takeoff.
To be fair if your robot takes off, you have lots of other problems
